rComments: This woman knows what she is talking about! She is a great professor and the readings, videos, and graphs are substantial to the course! I look forward to completing the final project for this class!
Great instructor ! lectures are clear and understandable. her lecture consists of video clips, powerpoints,so her lectures are not boring. she gives out a study guide for the final;very helpful
Favorite class so far at UCSC. She is caring, super smart, and great lecturer. Not an easy class but well worth it. Helps you prepare for all the other Soc classes.

The best soc class I've taken yet.  Greenberg is totally committed to the students and passionate about theory.  You do have to actually come to lecture and study (which some classmates aren't used to and whine about). But everyone I know who did got As. I had next to no preparation (recent transfer) and now love theory.

She was great.  Very clear lecturer.  Helpful in office hours.  Made theory interesting and relevant to our lives.  Created study guides, reading questions, posted lecture slides, additional readings, discussion forums, to help us understand.  Never seen another prof. work as hard as she does. Now love sociology.

I hated her with SOCY 10 and I still hate her in theory. Honestly, this woman takes theory and overcomplicates it to the point that it becomes incomprehensible, even after understanding the readings. I just wish someone else would teach this class since its a core class for sociology majors

Excellent.  Mixes lectures with media clips, art, and stories. Always opened lecture up for discussion - even memorized like 50 people's names.  Broke down complex, old, and hard to read theory, and brought it to life. Organized awesome ecommons site. Super smart but totally down to earth and kind. Go to her office hours!

Excellent.  Mixes lectures with media clips, art, and stories. Always opened lecture up for discussion - even memorized like 50 people's names.  Broke down complex, old, and hard to read theory, and brought it to life. Organized awesome ecommons site. Super smart but totally down to earth and kind. Go to her office hours!

I once heard that Greenberg was just too smart to teach this class. She definitely has an amazing grasp of the content, but her lectures are long and difficult to sit through. It feels like she's having a conversation with herself. Her voice puts you to sleep, but that doesn't disregard her passion and enthusiasm for the subject. Needs more energy!

Brilliant lectures, challenging reading, life-changing experience. I was nervous taking this theory class, but Greenberg breaks it down and helps us see the relevance in our lives. Recommend going to office hours, voluntary study sessions, online forums. You rarely see a prof who cares so much about students success in the class. I'll miss it!

Hands down one of the best classes I've had at UCSC.  Greenberg really cares about the issues, puts a huge amount of effort and material into lectures, and keeps students in a very large lecture thinking on their toes. Helped me understand the roots of many  problems in this country. Made me want to be soc major.  Highly reccommend!

This class was just ok. It was kind of depressing. Greenberg's sentences are interspersed with a lot of "uhhhhhh, ummmmm" as if she doesnt think before speaking. She demanded and berated us for not reading, but the syllabus outline of the reading was never right, and if you did it she ended up saying in class the next day, Ohh, not ch. 1, read ch.4

Beautiful human being with a very kind heart. At times the class seemed a bit disorganized. I recommend having a lot of prior knowledge about the structures of cities all around the world before taking this class, otherwise you will be bored. Weekly reading assignments, midterm 6 pg paper. Final 10-12 pg paper on a project of your choice.
